node.title: Ecuador says it will extend protections around the Galápagos Islands.
node.alt: Sea lions in a bay on Isabela Island in the Galapagos.
node.description: President Guillermo Lasso said his government had agreed with Ecuador’s fishery, tourism and conservation sectors to establish a marine reserve of more than 23,000 square miles.
node.content: ["In a bid to protect the Gal\u00e1pagos Islands, a volcanic Pacific archipelago where Charles Darwin saw a blueprint for the origin of every species, Ecuador\u2019s president said on Tuesday that his nation would expand the marine reserve around the natural treasures.", "\u201cToday is a day that will remain in history for us, Ecuador, Gal\u00e1pagos and the world,\u201d President Guillermo Lasso said at the climate summit in Glasgow. \u201cWe are not only preserving the future of our country, but the entire humanity.\u201d", "The government has agreed with the fishery, tourism and conservation sectors to establish a new marine reserve of more than 23,000 square miles in the Gal\u00e1pagos Islands.", "Mr. Lasso said it would be added to an existing marine reserve of about 50,000 square miles.", "As climate change warms the world\u2019s oceans, these islands are a crucible, and scientists are worried. Not only do the Gal\u00e1pagos sit at the intersection of three ocean currents, they are also in the cross hairs of El Ni\u00f1o, a climate phenomenon that can have wide-ranging effects on weather around the world.", "Research published in 2014 by more than a dozen climate scientists warned that rising ocean temperatures were making El Ni\u00f1o both more frequent and more intense. And UNESCO, the United Nations educational and cultural agency, says that the Gal\u00e1pagos Islands are one of the places most vulnerable to the effects of climate change.", "\u201cThis will not only strengthen the area\u2019s biodiversity, but it will also bolster our combat against climate change,\u201d Mr. Lasso said."]
